metadata.title: CVE-2022-1196 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
After a VR Process is destroyed, a reference to it may have been retainedand used, leading to a use-after-free and potentially exploitable crash.This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 91.8 and Firefox ESR < 91.8.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-1196` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 1:1snap1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:91.8.0+build2-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:91.8.0+build2-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:91.8.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:91.8.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:91.8.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:91.8.0+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:1snap1-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:91.8.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
